duck: Attenuation, a reduction in amplitude and intensity of a signal
Insertion loss, the decrease in transmitted signal power resulting from the insertion of a device in a transmission line or optical fiber
Bridging loss, the loss that results when an impedance is connected across a transmission line
Loss function, in statistics, a function representing the cost associated with an event
Loss leader a deliberate commercial loss made in the expectation of recouping it by profitable sales of other lines
Coupling loss, the loss that occurs when energy is transferred from one circuit, optical device, or medium to another
Return loss, the ratio of the amplitude of the reflected wave to the amplitude of the incident wave
Angular misalignment loss, power loss caused by the deviation from optimum angular alignment
Free-space path loss, the loss in signal strength that would result if all influences were sufficiently removed having no effect on its propagation
Path loss, the attenuation undergone by an electromagnetic wave in transit from a transmitter to a receiver
Round-trip loss in laser physics refers to energy lost due to scattering or absorption

milestones: Senator Ted Stevens loses re-election bid in Alaska ballot
Lesbians lose High Court marriage bid
Countryside Alliance lose legal case on UK fox hunting ban
Australian ministers lose veto power over territory laws
UK government loses personal information of 25 million people
Pluto loses planet status
Schröder loses motion of confidence
Italian PM Prodi loses confidence vote, resigns
Brazil women's national wheelchair basketball team loses first game in its 2012 Paralympic campaign
Canberra United lose first game since January 2011
Celtics lose, extend streak
Apple Corps loses court case against Apple Computer
Glenn Beck loses domain name case over parody website
Britain loses AAA credit rating due to poor economic growth and continued austerity
The Woodcraft Folk loses subsidy
Georgia mother loses child custody over humorous religion
Sydney FC to lose competition points
Gaddafi loses African Union chair
Wales loses all BBC TV and Radio services

wiki.text:
'Loss' may refer to:

*A negative difference between retail price and cost of production **Loss leader
a deliberate commercial loss made in the expectation of recouping it by
profitable sales of other lines *An event in which the team or individual in
question did not win *Loss (baseball), a pitching statistic in baseball
*Attenuation, a reduction in amplitude and intensity of a signal *In
telecommunications, loss is a decrease in signal in a communications system:
**Angular misalignment loss, power loss caused by the deviation from optimum
angular alignment **Bridging loss, the loss that results when an impedance is
connected across a transmission line **Coupling loss, the loss that occurs when
energy is transferred from one circuit, optical device, or medium to another
**Insertion loss, the decrease in transmitted signal power resulting from the
insertion of a device in a transmission line or optical fiber **Path loss, the
attenuation undergone by an electromagnetic wave in transit from a transmitter
to a receiver ***Free-space path loss, the loss in signal strength that would
result if all influences were sufficiently removed having no effect on its
propagation **Return loss, the ratio of the amplitude of the reflected wave to
the amplitude of the incident wave *Round-trip loss in laser physics refers to
energy lost due to scattering or absorption *Loss function, in statistics, a
function representing the cost associated with an event
wiki.title: Loss
